text: BACK TO POLICIES Supporting text 17.32 As set out in the Pubs in Tower Hamlets Evidence Base Study, a public house (pub) can be distinguished from a bar based on the following: z It genuinely has open access to all members of the community (albeit with possible minimum age restrictions) regardless of background and dress code. z Typically, they will be places that individuals or groups can visit to engage with others and provide an informal meeting place at different times of day or night. z Bars on the other hand might have more control over who can enter, sometimes through prohibitive pricing or dress code (actual or perceived), be less conducive to holding community meetings, and be geared more towards the ‘town centre’ night-time economy.
